position: Computational Physicist Intern (Fall Term: Aug - Dec 2021)
description:
The selected intern will support and run high performance computing software in a research and development environment. The position requires full-time commitment for summer 2021 and, depending on needs and the candidate’s skills and interest, may extend into the fall semester as a part-time position. Computational simulations are routinely performed to develop or improve TEL’s technology equipment and chemical/physical processes. The candidate should have strong interest in physics or chemistry, as well as experience in programming, understanding, and running scientific software. In most cases, the candidate will work with the software’s source codes written in C/C++ and Python. He/she will compile those codes on Linux, understand how they work based on documentation as well as on the source code itself, run them, and visualize the results. We will try to accommodate personal interests of the candidate to a particular area of research and simulations, be that atomistic molecular dynamics simulations such, for example, as with the LAMMPS code, or fluid-type simulations such as with openFoam, or plasma simulations, or kinetic Monte Carlo Particle-In-Cell simulations. Most of the codes are strongly parallelized for the multi-CPU environment, and correspondingly, the candidate should have some knowledge of OpenMPI and OpenMP to understand how the codes are functioning. The candidate will also assist with some of the fundamental scientific research and conduct technical searches in peer review journals.

  • This internship is payrolled via a payroll processing company.

Responsibilities:
  • Work independently (or with limited guidance) with the assigned complex scientific software.
  • Compile the software in Linux environment, including the current HPC environment.
  • Understand the software and the computational methods used in it.
  • Prepare input files and run particular cases of interest.
  • When needed, write shell scripts, or C/C++/Python routines to improve the software or add new capabilities.
  • Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines.
  • Train end users to any changes in code or operational procedures.
  • Write reports documenting everything learned and all results obtained.
  • Assist in conducting basic research.

Qualifications:
  • Experienced with Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Pursuing BS or advanced degree in physics, chemistry, engineering or computer science fields.
  • Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
  • Experienced in C/C++/Python programming languages.
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Capable of working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
  • Sitting for extended periods of time.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

Open Date: April 28, 2021

Close Date: May 14, 2021

Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. For more than a decade, our data insights, premium content, powerful technology, and scaled direct-to-consumer distribution have given us a competitive edge — leading us to improving advertising for all brands, publishers, and consumers.

How do we do this? With talented, passionate people like you! We bring together people from diverse backgrounds and give them an opportunity to bring their ideas to life.

Engineering is at the core of what we do at Xandr. Our Software Engineers play a pivotal role in developing, improving, and scaling our online advertising technology platform. Our software is complex, massively scaled, and built with a wide variety of languages and tools, lending itself to the most exciting and challenging technical problems.

About Corbus

Corbus Pharmaceuticals Holdings, Inc. is a clinical-stage company focused on the development and commercialization of novel medicines designed to target the endocannabinoid system. The Company’s lead product candidate, lenabasum, is a novel, oral, selective cannabinoid receptor type 2 (CB2) agonist designed to provide an alternative to immunosuppressive medications in the treatment of chronic inflammatory and fibrotic diseases.       • Triggers

  • Ability to multi-task and adapt to shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment.

position: Data Science Intern - Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience
description:
Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience

Data Science Internship

Oracle’s mission is to help people see data in new ways, discover insights, unlock endless possibilities. If you’re eager to spend your summer helping us do this and have the skills to do so, we have an internship opportunity for you with Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience.

Oracle Advertising is a leader in digital advertising. We bring data and technology together to help the world’s largest advertisers reach the right audience, in the right environment, and measure the impact of their campaigns.

To do this we rely on 80+ data scientists spanning teams that support our various products. You would join one of our Data Science teams to help enhance our analytic products and draw insights from them.

:

Dates: 8-12 weeks, summer 2021, dates flexible

Hours: full time, 40 hours per week, generally 8 am – 5 pm, Monday – Friday

Pay: highly competitive hourly rate based on education level & experience

Research & test new algorithms & methods to improve Oracle Advertising products

Develop & deploy new product features in collaboration with Product & Engineering teams

Ensure features are built at enterprise scale with quality & security built in

Conduct market-facing research and/or custom analyses for clients

Develop & deploy internal analytics tools

Meet weekly with your manager to discuss internship goals, progress & challenges

Present an overview of your intern experience to our Data Science team in August

Qualifications

:

To be considered for a Data Science Internship with Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience, you must possess the Objective Minimum Qualifications (OMQs) below.

Please ensure that your application clearly indicates that you meet these OMQs

, either on your resume and/or by uploading additional documents such as a transcript.

OMQs:
On track to earn bachelor’s or master’s degree in 2022 in a quantitative discipline—such as data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics, operations research, data analytics

Competency (e.g. able to use in project work with limited assistance) with 2 or more of the following data-science tools: Python, SQL, R, Hive, Spark, Hadoop, Scala

Proficiency (e.g. able to use in project work without assistance) with 2 or more of the following data-science methodologies: big-data querying, machine learning, data visualization, data mining, statistical inference/analysis, or equivalent.

Attend a university in the US

Able to obtain work authorization in the United States in 2021.

Have no more than 12 months of professional work experience in the technology field, EXCLUDING internships, research and/or teaching assistantship roles, and military experience. For information on currently open positions at oracle, please visit

http://oracle.com/goto/careers

Appetite to learn & capacity to do so quickly

Exceptional problem-solving skills—rooted in logic, science & collaboration

Strong communication skills that allow you turn complex analyses into actionable insights

Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience Offerings:
Highly competitive wage

Hands-on experience using data science to tackle real, vital & challenging ad-tech problems

Membership in Oracle Advertising’s vibrant, diverse Data Science organization

Access to Oracle Advertising’s big-data assets, tools & platforms

Mentor to guide you through your internship & encourage your development

description:
About Ulterra Drilling Technologies

Ulterra is the largest pure-play, independent supplier of PDC drill bits to the oil and gas industry. Originally founded in 2005 and strategically headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas, Ulterra is the market share leader in North America and one of the fastest growing PDC drill bit companies in the world. With field service locations all throughout the United States, Canada, and international, Ulterra is advantageously located near the drilling activity to provide direct support to operators across the globe. Ulterra is dedicated to the complete design, manufacture, and delivery of customized drilling solutions and application specific technology with unmatched speed-to-market. In addition to supplying operators with consistent quality and innovative designs, Ulterra works alongside operators to target any performance limitations to ensure monetary efficiency and performance productivity.

With over 400 employees worldwide, Ulterra strives to earn the trust of our customers through customer support and consistent performance. Spanning across offices and manufacturing facilities around the globe, Ulterra is a company of people and it’s our people that make the difference. Ulterra takes pride on engaging our employees to create innovative solutions by collaborating with one another and our customers to make a difference in the oilfield. It’s this empowerment and collaboration that fuels our innovation and sharpens our competitive edge.

Research & Development Intern, Petroleum Engineering & Computer Science

2. Assisting in the creation of web-based dashboards and evaluation software that improves the understanding and usage of drilling data acquired from Ulterra drill bits.

To be successful as an R&D intern, you must be highly self-motivated, proactive, have working knowledge of petroleum engineering, the inner workings of E&P companies, and software programming, and a drive to learn, build, and innovate on new methods that execute successful value creating campaigns.

position: Computational Physicist Intern (Fall Term: Aug - Dec 2021)
description:
The selected intern will support and run high performance computing software in a research and development environment. The position requires full-time commitment for summer 2021 and, depending on needs and the candidate’s skills and interest, may extend into the fall semester as a part-time position. Computational simulations are routinely performed to develop or improve TEL’s technology equipment and chemical/physical processes. The candidate should have strong interest in physics or chemistry, as well as experience in programming, understanding, and running scientific software. In most cases, the candidate will work with the software’s source codes written in C/C++ and Python. He/she will compile those codes on Linux, understand how they work based on documentation as well as on the source code itself, run them, and visualize the results. We will try to accommodate personal interests of the candidate to a particular area of research and simulations, be that atomistic molecular dynamics simulations such, for example, as with the LAMMPS code, or fluid-type simulations such as with openFoam, or plasma simulations, or kinetic Monte Carlo Particle-In-Cell simulations. Most of the codes are strongly parallelized for the multi-CPU environment, and correspondingly, the candidate should have some knowledge of OpenMPI and OpenMP to understand how the codes are functioning. The candidate will also assist with some of the fundamental scientific research and conduct technical searches in peer review journals.

  • This internship is payrolled via a payroll processing company.

Responsibilities:
  • Work independently (or with limited guidance) with the assigned complex scientific software.
  • Compile the software in Linux environment, including the current HPC environment.
  • Understand the software and the computational methods used in it.
  • Prepare input files and run particular cases of interest.
  • When needed, write shell scripts, or C/C++/Python routines to improve the software or add new capabilities.
  • Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines.
  • Train end users to any changes in code or operational procedures.
  • Write reports documenting everything learned and all results obtained.
  • Assist in conducting basic research.

Qualifications:
  • Experienced with Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Pursuing BS or advanced degree in physics, chemistry, engineering or computer science fields.
  • Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
  • Experienced in C/C++/Python programming languages.
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Capable of working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
  • Sitting for extended periods of time.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

Open Date: April 28, 2021

Close Date: May 14, 2021

Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.


Fermilab is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Underrepresented Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Discover Apple. We’re looking for people like you. Apple is a place where people from all backgrounds get together to do their life’s best work. Come join us. Corbus Pharmaceuticals Holdings, Inc. is a clinical-stage company focused on the development and commercialization of novel medicines designed to target the endocannabinoid system. The Company’s lead product candidate, lenabasum, is a novel, oral, selective cannabinoid receptor type 2 (CB2) agonist designed to provide an alternative to immunosuppressive medications in the treatment of chronic inflammatory and fibrotic diseases. Lenabasum is currently being evaluated in dermatomyositis and systemic lupus erythematosus. Corbus is also developing a pipeline of other preclinical drug candidates from its endocannabinoid system platform.

Lenabasum is not approved for the treatment of any indication. For more information on Corbus’ clinical programs, please visit here.

Juniper’s University Talent Program (UTP) introduces next generation talent to Juniper’s workforce and provides talented students with an opportunity to develop professional experience at a world-class technology company. And it’s not hard to see why so many accomplished students have been compelled to spend their summers at Juniper!

Here at Juniper, UTP provides a comprehensive program that fosters professional as well as personal growth, thoroughly preparing its interns for the next step in their careers. Juniper internships are project-based, allowing interns to solve important problems, make lasting impacts on their teams, and contribute to the company’s overall objectives. They are mentored by some of the most talented and skillful innovators in the industry; they connect with transformative thought leaders who promote disruptive ideas in their field. Interns participate in constructive professional workshops, company-wide community service initiatives, and executive speaker series. They build lasting friendships, expand their network, and connect with colleagues from around the world.

At Juniper Networks, you will not only have opportunities to build real-life, hands-on work experience – you’ll also have the chance to learn from the best and lay the groundwork for a successful career.

Please note that Juniper's 2021 internship program will be conducted remotely. The location listed reflects the location of the team the intern will join, whereas the intern will work from their residence in the US.

description:
Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience

Data Science Internship

Oracle’s mission is to help people see data in new ways, discover insights, unlock endless possibilities. If you’re eager to spend your summer helping us do this and have the skills to do so, we have an internship opportunity for you with Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience.

Oracle Advertising is a leader in digital advertising. We bring data and technology together to help the world’s largest advertisers reach the right audience, in the right environment, and measure the impact of their campaigns.

To do this we rely on 80+ data scientists spanning teams that support our various products. You would join one of our Data Science teams to help enhance our analytic products and draw insights from them.

:

Research & test new algorithms & methods to improve Oracle Advertising products

Develop & deploy new product features in collaboration with Product & Engineering teams

Ensure features are built at enterprise scale with quality & security built in

Conduct market-facing research and/or custom analyses for clients

Develop & deploy internal analytics tools

Meet weekly with your manager to discuss internship goals, progress & challenges

Present an overview of your intern experience to our Data Science team in August

Qualifications

:

, either on your resume and/or by uploading additional documents such as a transcript.

On track to earn bachelor’s or master’s degree in 2022 in a quantitative discipline—such as data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics, operations research, data analytics

Competency (e.g. able to use in project work with limited assistance) with 2 or more of the following data-science tools: Python, SQL, R, Hive, Spark, Hadoop, Scala

Proficiency (e.g. able to use in project work without assistance) with 2 or more of the following data-science methodologies: big-data querying, machine learning, data visualization, data mining, statistical inference/analysis, or equivalent.

Attend a university in the US

Able to obtain work authorization in the United States in 2021.

Have no more than 12 months of professional work experience in the technology field, EXCLUDING internships, research and/or teaching assistantship roles, and military experience. For information on currently open positions at oracle, please visit

http://oracle.com/goto/careers

Additional Preferred Qualifications:
Appetite to learn & capacity to do so quickly

Exceptional problem-solving skills—rooted in logic, science & collaboration

Strong communication skills that allow you turn complex analyses into actionable insights

Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience Offerings:
Highly competitive wage

Hands-on experience using data science to tackle real, vital & challenging ad-tech problems

Membership in Oracle Advertising’s vibrant, diverse Data Science organization

Access to Oracle Advertising’s big-data assets, tools & platforms

Mentor to guide you through your internship & encourage your development

Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.

position: Computational Physicist Intern (Fall Term: Aug - Dec 2021)
description:
The selected intern will support and run high performance computing software in a research and development environment. The position requires full-time commitment for summer 2021 and, depending on needs and the candidate’s skills and interest, may extend into the fall semester as a part-time position. Computational simulations are routinely performed to develop or improve TEL’s technology equipment and chemical/physical processes. The candidate should have strong interest in physics or chemistry, as well as experience in programming, understanding, and running scientific software. In most cases, the candidate will work with the software’s source codes written in C/C++ and Python. He/she will compile those codes on Linux, understand how they work based on documentation as well as on the source code itself, run them, and visualize the results. We will try to accommodate personal interests of the candidate to a particular area of research and simulations, be that atomistic molecular dynamics simulations such, for example, as with the LAMMPS code, or fluid-type simulations such as with openFoam, or plasma simulations, or kinetic Monte Carlo Particle-In-Cell simulations. Most of the codes are strongly parallelized for the multi-CPU environment, and correspondingly, the candidate should have some knowledge of OpenMPI and OpenMP to understand how the codes are functioning. The candidate will also assist with some of the fundamental scientific research and conduct technical searches in peer review journals.

  • This internship is payrolled via a payroll processing company.

Responsibilities:
  • Work independently (or with limited guidance) with the assigned complex scientific software.
  • Compile the software in Linux environment, including the current HPC environment.
  • Understand the software and the computational methods used in it.
  • Prepare input files and run particular cases of interest.
  • When needed, write shell scripts, or C/C++/Python routines to improve the software or add new capabilities.
  • Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines.
  • Train end users to any changes in code or operational procedures.
  • Write reports documenting everything learned and all results obtained.
  • Assist in conducting basic research.

Qualifications:
  • Experienced with Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Pursuing BS or advanced degree in physics, chemistry, engineering or computer science fields.
  • Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
  • Experienced in C/C++/Python programming languages.
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Capable of working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
  • Sitting for extended periods of time.

description:
Data Analyst Intern – Work from Home- USA

Are you looking for work experience with a global Fortune 500 company? Do you want to build transferable skills while learning about the commercial aspect of running a business? Join Western Union as a Data Analyst Intern.

  • Data skills: Excited to work with large, complex data structures.

Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. We are passionate about our diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status.

position: Data Science Intern - Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience
description:
Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience

Data Science Internship

Oracle’s mission is to help people see data in new ways, discover insights, unlock endless possibilities. If you’re eager to spend your summer helping us do this and have the skills to do so, we have an internship opportunity for you with Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience.

Oracle Advertising is a leader in digital advertising. We bring data and technology together to help the world’s largest advertisers reach the right audience, in the right environment, and measure the impact of their campaigns.

To do this we rely on 80+ data scientists spanning teams that support our various products. You would join one of our Data Science teams to help enhance our analytic products and draw insights from them.

Logistics

:

Location: Remote or at Oracle campus, Broomfield, CO (currently closed due to COVID-19)

Dates: 8-12 weeks, summer 2021, dates flexible

Hours: full time, 40 hours per week, generally 8 am – 5 pm, Monday – Friday

Pay: highly competitive hourly rate based on education level & experience

Responsibilities:
Support Data Science team’s key summer initiatives, which may involve the following:

Research & test new algorithms & methods to improve Oracle Advertising products

Develop & deploy new product features in collaboration with Product & Engineering teams

Ensure features are built at enterprise scale with quality & security built in

Conduct market-facing research and/or custom analyses for clients

Develop & deploy internal analytics tools

Meet weekly with your manager to discuss internship goals, progress & challenges

Present an overview of your intern experience to our Data Science team in August

Qualifications

:

To be considered for a Data Science Internship with Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience, you must possess the Objective Minimum Qualifications (OMQs) below.

Please ensure that your application clearly indicates that you meet these OMQs

, either on your resume and/or by uploading additional documents such as a transcript.

OMQs:
On track to earn bachelor’s or master’s degree in 2022 in a quantitative discipline—such as data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics, operations research, data analytics

Competency (e.g. able to use in project work with limited assistance) with 2 or more of the following data-science tools: Python, SQL, R, Hive, Spark, Hadoop, Scala

Proficiency (e.g. able to use in project work without assistance) with 2 or more of the following data-science methodologies: big-data querying, machine learning, data visualization, data mining, statistical inference/analysis, or equivalent.

Attend a university in the US

Able to obtain work authorization in the United States in 2021.

Have no more than 12 months of professional work experience in the technology field, EXCLUDING internships, research and/or teaching assistantship roles, and military experience. If you are interested in working at Oracle and you have more than 1 year of work experience in the technology field, please apply to Oracle's experienced job openings. For information on currently open positions at oracle, please visit

http://oracle.com/goto/careers

Additional Preferred Qualifications:
Appetite to learn & capacity to do so quickly

Exceptional problem-solving skills—rooted in logic, science & collaboration

Strong communication skills that allow you turn complex analyses into actionable insights

Oracle Advertising & Customer Experience Offerings:
Highly competitive wage

Hands-on experience using data science to tackle real, vital & challenging ad-tech problems

Membership in Oracle Advertising’s vibrant, diverse Data Science organization

Access to Oracle Advertising’s big-data assets, tools & platforms

Mentor to guide you through your internship & encourage your development

This job code is utilized for the majority of our temporary hires. The individual is performing hourly job duties as defined under the Fair Labor Standards Act.

If you are a Colorado resident, Please

Contact us

or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 21000919 in the subject line of the email.

Open Date: April 28, 2021

Close Date: May 14, 2021

Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.

position: Computational Physicist Intern (Fall Term: Aug - Dec 2021)
description:
The selected intern will support and run high performance computing software in a research and development environment. The position requires full-time commitment for summer 2021 and, depending on needs and the candidate’s skills and interest, may extend into the fall semester as a part-time position. Computational simulations are routinely performed to develop or improve TEL’s technology equipment and chemical/physical processes. The candidate should have strong interest in physics or chemistry, as well as experience in programming, understanding, and running scientific software. In most cases, the candidate will work with the software’s source codes written in C/C++ and Python. He/she will compile those codes on Linux, understand how they work based on documentation as well as on the source code itself, run them, and visualize the results. We will try to accommodate personal interests of the candidate to a particular area of research and simulations, be that atomistic molecular dynamics simulations such, for example, as with the LAMMPS code, or fluid-type simulations such as with openFoam, or plasma simulations, or kinetic Monte Carlo Particle-In-Cell simulations. Most of the codes are strongly parallelized for the multi-CPU environment, and correspondingly, the candidate should have some knowledge of OpenMPI and OpenMP to understand how the codes are functioning. The candidate will also assist with some of the fundamental scientific research and conduct technical searches in peer review journals.

  • This internship is payrolled via a payroll processing company.

Responsibilities:
  • Work independently (or with limited guidance) with the assigned complex scientific software.
  • Compile the software in Linux environment, including the current HPC environment.
  • Understand the software and the computational methods used in it.
  • Prepare input files and run particular cases of interest.
  • When needed, write shell scripts, or C/C++/Python routines to improve the software or add new capabilities.
  • Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines.
  • Train end users to any changes in code or operational procedures.
  • Write reports documenting everything learned and all results obtained.
  • Assist in conducting basic research.

Qualifications:
  • Experienced with Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Pursuing BS or advanced degree in physics, chemistry, engineering or computer science fields.
  • Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
  • Experienced in C/C++/Python programming languages.
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Capable of working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
  • Sitting for extended periods of time.

For more than a decade, our data insights, premium content, powerful technology, and scaled direct-to-consumer distribution have given us a competitive edge — leading us to improving advertising for all brands, publishers, and consumers.

How do we do this? With talented, passionate people like you! We bring together people from diverse backgrounds and give them an opportunity to bring their ideas to life.

Engineering is at the core of what we do at Xandr. Our Software Engineers play a pivotal role in developing, improving, and scaling our online advertising technology platform. Our software is complex, massively scaled, and built with a wide variety of languages and tools, lending itself to the most exciting and challenging technical problems.

About Corbus

Corbus Pharmaceuticals Holdings, Inc. is a clinical-stage company focused on the development and commercialization of novel medicines designed to target the endocannabinoid system. The Company’s lead product candidate, lenabasum, is a novel, oral, selective cannabinoid receptor type 2 (CB2) agonist designed to provide an alternative to immunosuppressive medications in the treatment of chronic inflammatory and fibrotic diseases. Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.

position: Computational Physicist Intern (Fall Term: Aug - Dec 2021)
description:
The selected intern will support and run high performance computing software in a research and development environment. The position requires full-time commitment for summer 2021 and, depending on needs and the candidate’s skills and interest, may extend into the fall semester as a part-time position. Computational simulations are routinely performed to develop or improve TEL’s technology equipment and chemical/physical processes. The candidate should have strong interest in physics or chemistry, as well as experience in programming, understanding, and running scientific software. In most cases, the candidate will work with the software’s source codes written in C/C++ and Python. He/she will compile those codes on Linux, understand how they work based on documentation as well as on the source code itself, run them, and visualize the results. We will try to accommodate personal interests of the candidate to a particular area of research and simulations, be that atomistic molecular dynamics simulations such, for example, as with the LAMMPS code, or fluid-type simulations such as with openFoam, or plasma simulations, or kinetic Monte Carlo Particle-In-Cell simulations. Most of the codes are strongly parallelized for the multi-CPU environment, and correspondingly, the candidate should have some knowledge of OpenMPI and OpenMP to understand how the codes are functioning. The candidate will also assist with some of the fundamental scientific research and conduct technical searches in peer review journals.

  • This internship is payrolled via a payroll processing company.

Responsibilities:
  • Work independently (or with limited guidance) with the assigned complex scientific software.
  • Compile the software in Linux environment, including the current HPC environment.
  • Understand the software and the computational methods used in it.
  • Prepare input files and run particular cases of interest.
  • When needed, write shell scripts, or C/C++/Python routines to improve the software or add new capabilities.
  • Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines.
  • Train end users to any changes in code or operational procedures.
  • Write reports documenting everything learned and all results obtained.
  • Assist in conducting basic research.

Qualifications:
  • Experienced with Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Pursuing BS or advanced degree in physics, chemistry, engineering or computer science fields.
  • Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
  • Experienced in C/C++/Python programming languages.
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Capable of working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
  • Sitting for extended periods of time.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

description:
Summary

Posted: Apr 27, 2021
Role Number:200242999
Discover Apple. We’re looking for people like you. Apple is a place where people from all backgrounds get together to do their life’s best work. Come join us. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services and customer experiences very quickly. Bring your passion to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish. Apple offers a collaborative work environment that fosters creativity and innovation.
Key Qualifications

Description
Software and Services Apple engineers have always focused on one person when they build software — the person who will use it. Working with them, you’ll see why every Apple product and service feels intuitive and simple, and why every aspect of this group’s work is built around a respect for the customer’s needs. Machine Learning and AI The people working here in machine learning and AI are building amazing experiences into every Apple product, allowing millions to do what they never imagined. Because Apple fully integrates hardware and software across every device, these researchers and engineers collaborate more effectively to improve the user experience while protecting user data. Come make an impact with the products you create and the research you publish. Hardware Our engineers have created some tough acts to follow, and they continue to lead us to innovative breakthroughs. Because they’re driven not by what would be easy, but by what would be amazing. Program Management PM teams are daring organizers and excellent leaders. They work cross-functionally with multiple teams throughout Apple as well as with external suppliers. Program Managers help set strategy, execute on schedule and are responsible for leading/communicating status and issues along the way. Design Apple products work beautifully because our designers maintain an intense focus on simplicity and usability. They judge the success of their work not by everything they put into it, but by everything the user gets out of it. Operations Apple's Operations teams ensure Apple’s cutting-edge designs become industry-leading products, delivered on time and on spec. They support the development, manufacturing, procurement, and fulfillment of all things Apple.
Education & Experience
Pursuing BS or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Data Science, and Design. You are additionally required to return to school after the internship to continue or complete your education, or an internship needs to be required for graduation from your school. You also qualify if accepted into a graduate program after graduation.

Grow your career with a growing organization

Whether they’re helping people reach their long-term financial goals or providing personal wealth management strategies, every associate contributes to changing the lives of those we serve for the better. When it comes to job satisfaction, that’s hard to beat. And from a personal satisfaction perspective, you’ll enjoy the freedom to support causes that matter to you and experience a truly inclusive work environment. Your future starts now.

Backend engineering at Personal Capital (Empower) is a lot about ownership, innovation and team spirit. Our engineers are problem solvers, smart , collaborative and strive in reaching the best practical solution in an agile environment in a diverse, inclusive environment.

As a Software Engineering Intern , you will work with various teams, stakeholders, developing software ranging from writing java programs , writing both unit and integration tests, develop CICD to make sure you integrate and deploy the application, which you will start owning as soon as you join. Personal Capital was born on the cloud and uses various latest technologies that a true tech company should use to handle flexible and highly scalable workload demand.

We offer an array of diverse and inclusive benefits regardless of where you are in your career. We believe that providing our employees with the means to lead healthy balanced lives results in the best possible work performance.

  • Retirement savings – 401(k) plan with generous company matching contributions (up to 5), financial advisory services, potential company discretionary contribution, and a broad investment lineup

Job Description

SRI's Computer Science Laboratory (CSL) seeks a candidate for an internship position in 2021 to work on designing, specifying and formalizing grammars and their parsing strategies. A successful candidate will undertake original research in grammar and parsing semantics, and their formalization in a theorem prover. The candidate will publish original research results, participate in the development of intellectual property, such as patent applications, and work collaboratively as a key contributor to existing and future research projects, including interdisciplinary research.

Qualifications

Working towards a Ph.D. in computer science or any related field, minimum of 3 years of research experience at a university or research lab (private or public). Knowledge of the following areas: automata theory, languages, parsing, grammars, formal methods and hardware synthesis. Written research papers demonstrating ability to conduct original research into parsing and parsing semantics. The abilities to work independently and collaboratively are both crucial, as remote work is likely.

Our work is everywhere you look – even if you can’t actually see it. Lam Research goes deeper than software or chips to the heart of the process that enables chip creation. So if you want to help power the components that empower everything, join us.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

We Look Forward to Your Application

Our Story

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. The organization also includes Xandr’s suite of advanced advertising solutions designed to help to improve advertising for brands, publishers, and consumers.

Xandr is a technology platform powering one of the largest global Advanced TV and Video advertising marketplaces in the industry. For more than a decade, our data insights, premium content, powerful technology, and scaled direct-to-consumer distribution have given us a competitive edge — leading us to improving advertising for all brands, publishers, and consumers.

How do we do this? With talented, passionate people like you! We bring together people from diverse backgrounds and give them an opportunity to bring their ideas to life.

The Job

Engineering is at the core of what we do at Xandr. Our Software Engineers play a pivotal role in developing, improving, and scaling our online advertising technology platform. Our software is complex, massively scaled, and built with a wide variety of languages and tools, lending itself to the most exciting and challenging technical problems.

We seek an intern with experience in software design and development who is looking to gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company.

The Daily

This program will have our interns work side-by-side, virtually this year, with the team’s software engineers while we develop new features and functionality for our clients and business partners. They will be a contributing part of all our team’s daily status and weekly planning meetings, along with any design and problem-solving activities the team conducts.

We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative and has a sincere desire for learning and growth.

  • You are a currently enrolled student with a BA/BS or Master’s degree expected in December 2021 or Spring 2022 in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or a related field
  • You are familiar with Computer Science fundamentals with regards to data structures, algorithms, and time complexity
  • You have foundational knowledge of programming languages (such as Python, and/or R, and/or SQL) and various operating systems (Linux, Mac, Windows)
  • You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower others
  • You like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happen
  • You care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystem
  • You believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools

Internship Program

  • Students must apply by the application deadline on February 26.
  • Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship
  • Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration
  • Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duration

The Perks

  • Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
  • Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
  • Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more

Company Description


Corbus Culture:

Corbus is a close-knit team of high-achieving, innovative, creative and, above all else, passionate employees. We hire for personality as well as for skill. At Corbus, we take pride in our “family” atmosphere where each person’s contribution is vital to our success. As a Corbus employee, you are empowered to think creatively and be proactive in your approach. There is no place for politics or red tape here.

About Corbus

Corbus Pharmaceuticals Holdings, Inc. is a clinical-stage company focused on the development and commercialization of novel medicines designed to target the endocannabinoid system. The Company’s lead product candidate, lenabasum, is a novel, oral, selective cannabinoid receptor type 2 (CB2) agonist designed to provide an alternative to immunosuppressive medications in the treatment of chronic inflammatory and fibrotic diseases. Lenabasum is currently being evaluated in dermatomyositis and systemic lupus erythematosus. Corbus is also developing a pipeline of other preclinical drug candidates from its endocannabinoid system platform.

Lenabasum is not approved for the treatment of any indication. For more information on Corbus’ clinical programs, please visit here.

For more information, visit http://www.corbuspharma.com/, and connect with us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.

Corbus Pharmaceuticals Holdings, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer


Job Description


Corbus Pharmaceuticals is seeking a curious and independent data science intern to lead the development of an advanced analytics function as part of the Operations & Analytics team. This individual will have strong input into the design and structure of this new function aimed at generating actional insights to fuel data-driven decision making.

Typical Responsibilities will vary based on need and candidate skillset and may include:

  • Engineer data features required for advanced modelling

  • Ability to analyze large data sets using SQL, Tableau or other BI tools preferred
  • Excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail, ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously
  • Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship or restriction now or in the future; fluent in business English

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:

Are you looking for work experience with a global Fortune 500 company? Do you want to build transferable skills while learning about the commercial aspect of running a business? Join Western Union as a Data Analyst Intern.

Close Date: May 14, 2021

Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.


Fermilab is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Underrepresented Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.


Fermilab is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Underrepresented Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans are encouraged to apply.
